p: The paper disc-diffusion method was employed for the determination of antimicrobial activities [ 24]. Briefly, suspension in LB or SDB of the tested microorganism (0.1 ml of 10 7–10 8 cells per ml) was spread on the solid media plates. Paper discs (9 mm in diameter) were impregnated with 12 μl of the oil and placed on the inoculated plates. These plates, after remaining at 4°C for 2 h, were incubated at 37°C for 24 h for bacteria and 48 h at 35°C for Candida. The diameter of the inhibition zones was measured in millimeters. All the tests were performed in triplicate and repeated twice. These data were compared to antibiotics and antifungals with recommended doses used as positive controls tested and in the presence of negative control.
